metadata.Title: CVE-2011-5320 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
scanf and related functions in glibc before 2.15 allow local users to causea denial of service (segmentation fault) via a large string of 0s.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-5320` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.6').
